author: Reuters Editorial
title: Peru cenbank says may cut interest rate again if inflation surprises
text:
LIMA, March 9 (Reuters) - Peruâ€™s central bank cut the benchmark interest rate this week because of uncertainty over economic growth and public investments, and would have room for a new reduction if inflation slowed unexpectedly, a bank official said on Friday.
The central bank now expects the annual inflation rate to fall to about 0.6 percent from 1.18 percent by the end of this month - under its 1 to 3 percent target range, Jorge Estrella told journalists on a conference call. (Reporting By Teresa Cespedes Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)
Our Standards: The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.
